body_html:
@yaroslavvb Thanks for your suggestion! Yes, I agree with you that casting object to string is a really awkward solution.

As for the two solutions you advised, I will take a try:

  1. Find a way to make np.asarray recognize tf.Dimension as int, or
  2. Cast tf.Dimension to int before np.asarray call.
body_text:
@yaroslavvb Thanks for your suggestion! Yes, I agree with you that casting object to string is a really awkward solution.
As for the two solutions you advised, I will take a try:

Find a way to make np.asarray recognize tf.Dimension as int,  or
Cast tf.Dimension to int before np.asarray call.
body:
@yaroslavvb Thanks for your suggestion! Yes, I agree with you that casting object to string is a really awkward solution. 

As for the two solutions you advised, I will take a try:

1. Find a way to make `np.asarray` recognize tf.Dimension as int,  or
2. Cast tf.Dimension to int before `np.asarray` call.
